dt: {bc}to put or allow for in a statement or plan coordinating resources and expenditures {bc}to put or allow for in a {d_link|budget|budget:1}

dt.t: {wi}budgeted{/wi} $200 a month to pay back student loans
funds {wi}budgeted{/wi} by the administration for the project

dt: {bc}to require to adhere to a budget
{bc}to plan or provide for the use of in detail

shortdef: to put or allow for in a statement or plan coordinating resources and expenditures : to put or allow for in a budget
to require to adhere to a budget
to allocate funds for in a budget

dt: {bc}a usually leather pouch, wallet, or pack
{bc}a quantity (as of energy or water) involved in, available for, or assignable to a particular situation

dt.t: the A-bomb … yields its {wi}budget{/wi} of energy … in a fraction of a second

dt: {bc}an account of gains and losses of such a quantity

{bc}a statement of the financial position of an administration (as of a nation) for a definite period of time based on estimates of {d_link|expenditures|expenditure} during the period and proposals for financing them
{bc}a plan for the coordination of resources and expenditures
{bc}the amount of money that is available for, required for, or assigned to a particular purpose

dt.t: a weekly {wi}budget{/wi} for a family of five

et: Middle English {it}bowgette{/it}, from Middle French {it}bougette{/it}, diminutive of {it}bouge{/it} leather bag, from Latin {it}bulga{/it}, of Celtic origin; akin to Middle Irish {it}bolg{/it} bag; akin to Old English {it}belg{/it} bag {ma}{mat|belly|}{/ma}
shortdef: a usually leather pouch, wallet, or pack; also : its contents
a quantity (as of energy or water) involved in, available for, or assignable to a particular situation; also : an account of gains and losses of such a quantity
